page.title: 07Schooling of local children
page.content: The {United Reformed Play-School} has thirty seven children from 2 months to 5 years, most of them from Repton. On the day we visited, some of them were visiting the Zoo. {St.Wystans Primary School }has children from about 2 to 11 years old. There are 100 children coming from Burton, Newton Solney and Derby. Many of these go on to Abbots Bromley or Malvern if they are girls or to Foremarke Hall or the local state school (John Port) if they are boys. The {Church of England aided }school at Newton Solney was built in 1860 and caters for 73 children.The school was due to be closed but recently has been saved by very strong local support. The largest school (apart from {Repton {School) }is the{local village school} which has now moved to new builbings on the edge of the village.
